reviews.review: Trés bon jeu ;) En promo ou pas, ne pas hésiter a l'acheter !
Epic Storyline. America summed up in one game.

Boring straight FPS with none of the charm of the others. This is BioShock in name only - the story and setting do not even relate to the rest of the franchise, other than a couple of minor similarities and a pointless (spoiler alert) cameo at the end. The DLC also attempts to shoehorn the stories together - poorly, but really I don't know why this even bothers to be called "BioShock". It is entirely dissimilar, and when you take away this being a sequel (since it isn't), what you're left with is really just a boring shooter with a couple of interesting but repetative mechanics, all of which were much-better executed in the first two games.

All that said, the non-gamey elements (for example, the opening sequence, everything up until you immediately need to kill or be killed), are completely excellent. It really set me up for a let down, as it had such a strong start. The story itself (for the main game, not the DLC) is interesting right up until the end (which.. to put it lightly, is awful). If this did not have the BioShock name, or the poorly-copied BioShock-like elements, I probably would have enjoyed it more.

Also skylines. Those things are completely stupid.

A truly remarkable game, in fact, probably one of my all time favorites. Not only does this game have a beautiful environment, the story is to die for. The whole way through I really felt like I was Booker Dewitt, not just a detached player. If you haven't played this game yet, what are you waiting for? Go out and buy it this second, it will be the best thing you've ever spent money on. Just make sure you watch out for spoilers, the ending is truly monumental and magnificent.

Олдскульный геймплей без регенерации здоровья и перестрелок из-за укрытий, увлекательный и дающий простор применить фантазию - как перестрелять всех из старого доброго ружья, так и изящно скормить воронам поджаренных предварительно врагов.
"Вкусная" работа дизайнеров и художников, которая оставит в мозгу горсти запомнившихся видов.

Not having playing BioShock Infinite until a year after its initial release in 2013 I didn't think I was missing much, but now I have played it I can now clearly understand the phenomenal hype for Infinite back in 2013. I have never played a game that is so visually vibrant, colourful and downright beautiful as Bioshock Infinite, my eyes felt like they were orgasming everytime I gazed upon its glory.
The BioShock series has always produced quality games that are rich with story and content......or so I've been told. I'm also ashamed to say that I have not played the prievous two games in the franchise. But I can assure you after playing Infinite for 10 minutes I put both BioShock 1 and 2 straight onto my wishlist. Obviously I'm being biased, but I don't see how the  predecessors could top Infinite in content, gameplay and of course storyline.
The main protagonist Booker Dewitt, voiced by the talented Troy Baker (who has just about provided his voice to every notable gaming franchise on the planet, go check his IMDB page and see for yourself) has been assigned one task, "bring us the girl and wipe away the debt" sounds simple right? Set in the city of Columbia, a floating Utopia that resides higher than the clouds, quite the contrast when comapred with Rapture, the underwater paradise. This venture develops into a story that's so addictive and interesting that you'll be finding it hard not to complete it in a single sitting. But try to space it out and make it last, something my good friend Lar failed to do.
The game is catergorised as a FPS and I'd class it as one of the best FPS games of 2013. The firefights you're a part of are so fun and exciting, thanks to the game mechanics and the badass artillery. The game features bog-standard foot soldiers as the games primary enemies, however there is a whole host of wierd and wonderful adversarys like the Handyman who looks like it has the body structure of a mechanical gorilla with a spud for a head to the Patriots who come in a fabulous array of models (I feel like I'm hosting  a catwalk shoot) ranging from Abraham Lincoln to George Washington. The foes that I personally found the wierdiest and definitely the freakiest are the 'Boys of Silence', trust me you won't forget your encounter. 
Alongside Booker, you have Elizabeth who acts as your companion throughout the majority of the game, although she doesn't attack enemies, she sure is handy to have in your company. Elizabeth helps by tossing you health, ammo and money when you desperately need them. But Elizabeth do you have to throw money my way when I'm in the middle of a shootout? Despite that , Elizabeth is definitely one of the greatest companions I've ever come across in a game. She's just so damn adorable. Personally I hate games where you have to protect companions constantly to a point where you actually forget the initial objective, a little game called Resisdent Evil 4 springs to mind. However Elizabeth is unlike most followers as she can take care of herself and avoid danger entirely. Which makes me wonder, do the enemies just go by the rule of 'no hitting girls' or does Elizabeth use her feminine charms to her advantage? Hmmmmmm. Lastly, the character that I find most memorable is The Songbird. Songbird acts as Elizabeth's guardian and protector, stopping at nothing to ensure her safety (Watch out Mr. DeWitt).  The Songbird's shriek is one that will make your hairs stand on end, pierce your ear drums and stay with you forever. You'll know when he's closing in.
There is one thing I must cover before I conclude this review of BioShock Infinite and that  is the mind blowing ending to the game. Don't worry I won't spoil it, but I have never been so dazzeled and shocked by an ending to a game, until I finished Infinite. I place BioShock Infinite at the top of the best endings to any game in the history of games, it'll leave you wide eyed, gaping mouthed and dumb struck. And so I recommend BioShock Infinite to anyone who enjoys quality entertainment. To be honest Infinite's conclusion blew my mind so much that I'm still picking up the fragments, even as I write this review.
came for waifus, stayed to eat toilet taters

Truly one of the most beautiful games I've ever played, both in term of plot and apperance. I don't usually like FPS, which is why BioShock was such a shock to me, but after the first hour or so of gameplay I became completely immersed and genuinely began to care for the characters. The only problem I have is with the two weapon capacity, unless you find the two best weapons in game you're pretty much stuck during the final confrontation. However, the use of vigors more than makes up for this. 

Buy this game you won't regret it!

Bioshock Infinty ist ein sehr unterhaltsames und interessantes Spiel. Von der Spielzeit her ist es für meine Fälle leider etwas zu kurz ausgefallen. Wobei ich zugeben muss nicht in jedem Winkel und in jeder Ecke reingeschaut zu haben. 

Grafisch ist es ein sehr ansehenliches Spiel und der Grafikstil ist ansprechend und an manchen Stellen sogar atemberaubend.
Spielphysik und Egoshooterfeeling sind auch zu  meiner vollster Zufriedenheit umgesetzt worden. Es gab nichts an der Spielphysik oder an der AI was mich genervt oder gestört hat. Einfach ein solides und einfaches Egoshooter Erlebnis.

Story und Characktere sind mit der größte Pluspunkt an diesem Spiel. Mich hat die Story von der ersten Sekunde an mitgerissen und bis zum Ende nicht mehr losgelassen. Vor allem mein Beschützerinstinkt für Elizabeth wurde immer wieder auf harte Probem gestellt und man fühlt sich im Laufe des Spiels echt dazu verpflichtet alles für dieses kleine süße Mädel zu tun.

Mein Fazit ein absoluter muss Titel für Leute die an einem soliden Egoshooter mit einer Hollywood reifen Story interessiert sind.
Лучшая!

I would recommend this game any day without even thinking too much.

I bought all three of the Bioshock games together and played them back to back. I really enjoyed the other two games and was initially turned off by how different Infinite was from the other games, gameplay mechanics had been changed, new control layouts, etc. But as I progressed through the game I started to enjoy it and at the end I knew this game was on par or even better than the previous two installments. This game is playable without having to play the previous two games but i'd reccomend playing Bioshock 1 and 2 first as they all tie together in the end.

I just finished the game last night. I can easily say this was one of the best games I have played. I loved the original also and this release was, IMHO, just as good. The storyline was superb and the characters very memorable. My only small gripe was the save system. It uses checkpoints, which is fine, but in some places they are a bit too far apart. I.E. you can make a good bit of progress and still have a good ways to go to the next save. Not a big deal but found myself having to choose between staying up too late to get to the next checkpoint or redoing 20-30 minutes of play next time I could play. 

The only other thing is that you can only carry two weapons at a time. Again not a biggy, in reality the game generally provides the right type of weapon for the fights you are getting into.

I thorougly enjoyed the game, and just purchased the DLC which is downloading as i'm typing this.
I will update after playing the DLC, but expect it will be just as polished as the base game is.
So far the Bioshock series, Half-life series, Portal 1&2, and Metro series rank as my favorites in the last 5 years.
Those are going to be hard to beat, next up I think I will be trying the Far Cry series, have heard good things about it.
i liked the original better but damn the detail in this game. still amazing tho, looking forward to the dlcs.
